docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's travel ban faced its toughest test yet Tuesday as a panel of appeals court judges hammered away at the administration's claim that the ban was motivated by terrorism fears while also directing pointed questions to an attor...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Donald Trump's travel ban faced its toughest test yet Tuesday as a panel of appeals court judges hammered away at the administration's claim that the ban was motivated by terrorism fears while also directing pointed questions to an attorney challenging the executive order on grounds that it unconstitutionally targeted Muslims.

headline.main: Judges Hammer Attorneys on Both Sides of Travel Ban Case
headline.print_headline: Judges Hammer Attorneys on Both Sides of Travel Ban Case

docs.snippet: President Trump’s order prompted some carriers to make it easier for the small number of affected tourists to rebook. But it was business as usual for many airlines....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s order prompted some carriers to make it easier for the small number of affected tourists to rebook. But it was business as usual for many airlines.

headline.main: Immigration Ban Prompts Fee Waivers and Refunds From Airlines

docs.snippet: The White House is confident that it will prevail in a legal back-and-forth over President Donald Trump's executive order to prevent travelers from seven countries entering the United States, spokesman Sean Spicer said on Monday....

docs.snippet: Through a Super Bowl ad, public statements and court filings, Silicon Valley's biggest companies are taking a strong stand against President Donald Trump's travel ban, saying high tech needs immigrants' creativity and energy to stay competitive....

byline.contributor: Ron Nixon reported from Washington, and Nicholas Kulish from New York.
byline.original: By RON NIXON and NICHOLAS KULISH

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's immigration and travel ban made "an awful lot of sense" but probably should have been delayed at least long enough to brief Congress about it, Homeland Security Secretary John Kelly told lawmakers Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Donald Trump's immigration and travel ban made "an awful lot of sense" but probably should have been delayed at least long enough to brief Congress about it, Homeland Security Secretary John Kelly told lawmakers Tuesday.

headline.main: DHS Chief: Travel, Immigration Ban Should Have Been Delayed
headline.print_headline: DHS Chief: Travel, Immigration Ban Should Have Been Delayed
